Dear Keisha Taylor:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to
the violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• Repeat violations
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

Sincerely,

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program statement.
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth B reported that Youth A touched Youth B’s thigh. Youth B
informed the team leaders of the incident, and nothing was done
about it. Youth A stated it was the other way around and that
Youth B touched Youth A’s thigh and that this occurred several
times when they had to eat in their Personal Isle (P Isle) due to
COVID. Youth A and Youth B would be sitting next to each other.
Youth A reported staff were present and usually eating or doing
paperwork. Youth A filed several PREA complaints and did talk to
the PREA “people”, but nothing was done about it. Youth A and
Youth B continued to share a P isle even after Youth A
complained. Youth B and Youth C both made PREA complaints
against Youth A as well, but they were false. They alleged Youth
A touched their breast and bottoms. When Youth A told staff
Youth B was touching Youth A, they would say there was no proof
because the cameras did not work.
Investigation This complaint came in after all youth had been removed from the
facility and all staff either reassigned or terminated. A complaint
was being investigated under Special Investigation
2023C0000368 and this additional information was received and
assigned as a separate investigation.
Interviews
During a previous investigation Youth B/Complainant was
interviewed by a courtesy DHHS Worker on 5/2/23 and reported
Youth C would touch Youth B’s head and neck and stare at her
when she was sleeping. She further reported Youth A would ask
about having sex with her and would touch her thigh. Youth B
reported she informed the treatment leaders, Staff 1 and Staff 2,
but nothing was done to address the issue.
Youth B was interviewed by phone on 10/2/2023. Youth B
reported a situation with Youth C happened in the early morning
hours just before wake-up. Youth B woke when she felt something
on her neck. At first she thought it was her braid but realized
Youth C was leaning over her. Youth C had gotten out of her bed
and was walking around the unit. Youth B sat up in bed and put
her hands in her lap. She then woke Staff 4, up (This is being
investigated under 2024C0000816SI). Youth B told the Staff 4
2

what happened. Youth B reported the Staff 4 told Staff 2 what
happened.
Regarding Youth A, Youth B stated the staff at the facility told her
she should stay away from Youth A. She did not indicate what
staff told her this. Youth B said her and Youth A started out getting
along but then Youth A started to ask personal questions that
Youth B did not like about who she was dating. She said Youth A
was pushy about it. Youth B said she told Youth A she was
straight and left it at that. Youth B got to the point where she was
avoiding Youth A and this started to make Youth A mad. After this
they did not get along and even got into a fight. Youth A's behavior
escalated after that. Youth B said Youth A would rub up against
her in line. Youth A said she brought the incident up to the
supervisor. Youth B could not recall the name of the supervisor.
After Youth B told she moved bunks right next to Youth A. Youth B
wrote a statement and gave it to Staff 2. Staff 2 laughed at her
and never gave the statement to the supervisor. About a month
later she wrote another statement and put it in the grievance box.
After she wrote the second statement, she talked to a PREA
person. She could not recall who the PREA person was.
Youth A was interviewed by telephone on 8/25/23. She
reported she left the facility in November of 2022. She said she
was on the same unit as Youth B and they even shared a
personal isle (P isle) where their beds were near each other.
Youth A stated she hated Youth B. She never had romantic
feelings for her. Youth A said Youth B told her she had a crush on
Youth A but Youth A told her no. Youth A stated there was never
any touching by her. She said Youth B would touch Youth A. She
said Youth B placed her hand on Youth A's knee. When Youth B
did this Youth A would move her hand away. Youth A said she
told Staff 2 but the behavior continued. Youth A said she asked
Youth B to stop but she wouldn't. Youth A said this happened
when they were quarantined due to COVID and the 2 youth had to
eat in the P isle next to each other. At the time staff would be
eating or doing paperwork. When Youth A would say something to
staff, the staff would say there was no proof because the cameras
were not working. Staff 2 told Youth A she would talk to Youth B
but said she did not think Youth B would do that. Youth A said the
PREA person did question her because Youth B said it was Youth
A who was touching Youth B. Youth A said she filled out multiple
PREA forms, but they had many on her. Youth A never saw Youth
C do anything to Youth B. She reported Youth C also claimed
Youth A touched her, but she didn't. Youth A could not recall who
3

the PREA person was, and she could not remember the other
staff she talked to about the touching.
Youth C was interviewed via video conferencing from her
current placement on 8/31/23. Youth C was asked about her
relationship with Youth A and she stated the two of them did not
get along and tried fighting each other daily. She did not like Youth
A because she would put feces on the bathroom wall, overflow the
toilet, and get urine on the floor. She stayed away from Youth A.
Youth A would ask her to date her and try to get her to go to the
bathroom with her. Youth C refused to go. Youth A touched Youth
C's butt while they were play fighting and Youth A asked Youth C
to get naked. Youth C said she told Staff 3 about these behaviors,
but she did not do anything about it. She said this occurred right
after Youth C got to the facility. Youth C said she talked to the
PREA person whose name she could not recall. Youth C said she
filled out the PREA forms. Youth C said she remained on Youth
A's unit after writing the forms. Youth C reported one time she was
in the bathroom and Youth A walked in and tried to touch her.
Youth C said she did not tell anyone because she knew nothing
would be done. Youth C reported Youth A was not doing these
things to any of the other girls.
The Chief Administrator (CA) was interviewed face to face on
9/13/23. He reported when a youth has a PREA complaint they
submit a form and within so many hours they follow up on it. 95%
of complaints were not PREA. Many of them were about a youth
showing too much skin or were naked. The girls would report that
they felt uncomfortable. If there were PREA concerns the youth
would most likely be moved to a different unit. Youth A was one
who moved from every unit. If a staff becomes aware of a PREA
complaint, they are to notify the PREA officer and/or the director. It
would also be logged in the supervisor logbook. CA stated he was
not familiar with Staff 1, but he knew Staff 2 and she would always
follow procedure.
Two messages were left for Staff 1 on 9/20/23 and 9/25/23 but
a return call was not received. Staff 1 no longer works for the
facility.
Staff 2 was interviewed by telephone on 9/20/23. She stated
she was a team leader at the facility for 6 months but had been
working at the facility for 15 years. She did not receive any reports
of the girls touching one another. She was aware Youth A, Youth
B, and Youth C did not get along but none of them reported
anything inappropriate occurring between them to her. If Staff 2
4

were to get complaints for girls touching each other she would
take it to the shift leader to handle it. She said the girls would also
need to be separated. She said she recalled Youth B and Youth C
being on a unit together but were on opposite sides of the unit and
Youth A was in a different unit.
Two messages were left for Staff 3 on 8/1/23 and 8/14/23 but
she did not return the phone calls. Staff 3 no longer works at
the facility.
Documents Reviewed:

• Staff 1 employee file: Staff 1 was hired on 4/24/19. She
was disciplined on 12/10/22 for being late returning from
break. She had PREA training on 2/10/23.
• Staff 2 employee file: Staff 2 was hired on 12/2/11. She did
not have any disciplines. She had PREA training on 2/9/23.
• Youth A Case file: Youth A was at the facility from 12/8/21
to 10/28/22. While at the facility Youth A had behaviors that
included exposing her naked body and private parts to
5

peers and staff, aggression towards both staff and peers,
and property destruction. The facility asked for Youth A’s
removal due to her behavioral issues. Youth A does have a
history of sexual abuse but there was no prior history of
sexual acting out behaviors in her file.
• Youth B Case File: Youth B was at the facility from 7/25/22
to 3/9/23. Youth B did not have any major incidents or
behavioral issues at the facility. She does have a history of
being manipulative and making false allegations.
• Youth C Case File: Youth C was at the facility from 8/25/22
until 3/16/23. Youth C has a history of being verbally and
physically aggressive, destructive of property, suicidal
thoughts, and poor peer relationships. Youth C has made
allegations of sexual abuse however would later say she
lied about them.
• PREA Policy: Under staff response to Sexual Assault the
policy states the staff made aware of the allegations must
report them to the supervisor immediately.
Analysis Based on the length of time and the differing accounts, there is not
enough evidence to prove the facility was not following their PREA
policy.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4132 Grievance procedures.
Section (4) An agency shall provide a grievant with a written copy of the
Description grievance resolution.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The facility did not have a written response to grievances filed by
the youth.
Investigation Interview:
During interviews with Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C they
indicated they filed grievances, but those grievances were never
followed up on.
Documents Reviewed:
• The grievance form utilized by the facility has a section for
interviews that were completed, findings, and follow-up with
youth.
• Grievance forms reviewed for the above investigation did
not include findings.
• Three additional grievances filed by youth at the facility did
not include the findings or follow-up with the youth.
6

Analysis The documentation reviewed for this investigation did not include
findings or follow-up with the youth.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon approval of a corrective action plan it is
recommended that the current license status be continued.
